resources.string: Have you ever had questions that you cannot find an answer? Philosophy is continuously trying to find solutions to issues like that. If you want to have a better critical thinking philosophy is the way to go. This course is going to give a quick course on philosopher and types of philosophy.

Have you ever thought about why things act the way they do or why they move the way they do? Physics means "knowledge of nature" and studies matter, its motion, the behavior through space and time and studies the subsequent energies and forces.

Logic - Reasoning and how thoughts should be expressed; recognize fallacies. 
 Ethics - Express reasons in support of moral claims; understand that there are better and worse reasons for making a moral decision. 
 Metaphysics: Personal Identity - Personal interpretation and recognition of our criteria and the capability of considering that our common sense beliefs of ourselves may be mistaken. 
 Metaphysics: Mind-Body Problem - Understand central problems concerning the conception of mind. 
 Epistemology - Understand the major philosophical approaches to epistemology and the complexity of how people interact with knowledge. 
 Philosophy of Religion - Learn the theistic conception of God and different arguments for the existence of God; Comprehend the dilemma of evil for theistic belief, and understand the complexity of evaluating justified religious belief.

Have you ever thought about why things act the way they do or why they move the way they do? Physics means \'knowledge of nature\' and studies matter, its motion, the behavior through space and time and studies the subsequent energies and forces. If you are interested in learning more about your surrounding this course is perfect for you.

Principles of Conservation 
 Gravitation and the Solar System 
 The Special Theory of Relativity 
 Thermodynamics 
 Sound and Light 
 Optical Systems 
 The Atom and Radioactivity 
 Nuclear Radiation

When people ask me what philosophy is about I tend to use this analogy, philosophy is the soil in a beautiful garden, where trees are subjects like chemistry and physics that is everything that exists - I am pretty sure that someone used that analogy before - everything that is not science yet, all the questions that we do not have data or information about, but that still have great importance, and a significant meaning behind it, a scientist with an open mind is a philosopher, for that reason philosophy should be a full-time job, because it develops a critical thinking and a constant need for discussion. When I try to explain what philosophy is about I typically say this: Philosophy means the love for knowledge, we should have that as a standard. Plato collects Socrates speeches in the "Apology" were you can find the infamous quote "the unexamined life is not worth living," he stated that when he choose dying over Athens (his home) or committing to silence, we should make our life about being better even if life strives to limit you, but that will be discussed later in a different chapter.

History is a very important subject because it shows how the past was, and without the past we lose how future. \n History shows us how we should act and not to make the same mistakes. \n Here you will learn the very basics of history.

First Civilizations 
 Age of Exploration 
 Industrialism 
 World Wars
Formal logic is the study of inference with purely formal content.
Informal logic is the study of natural language arguments.
Symbolic logic is the study of symbolic abstractions that capture the formal features of logical inference.
Mathematical logic is an extension of symbolic logic into other areas, in particular to the study of model theory, proof theory, set theory, and recursion theory.

I am a 16-year-old programmer (at the time of writing) that as always liked to know new things, so I decided to make a app that would help me learn and share it with others. \n This app is a gathering of content that I made and content that I thought it would represent a certain subject in the best way. \n All the work that was used during the making of this app is going to be cited under the about section.
